transcript.title: AUSTRALIAN COUNCIL FOR THE ARTS
transcript.content:
PRIME MINISTER Press Statement No.~ 199
8 March 1974
AUSTRALIAN COUNCIL FOR THE ARTS
The Visual Arts Board of the Australian Council
for the Arts has embarked on an imaginative project
known as " Art in Public". The Board believes it has a
responsibility to provide works of art in areas that are
culturally underprivileged. It wants these works to
be in public places where people will see and enjoy them.
I am happy to announce that I have approved the
first three projects for the " Art in Public" program.
The first of them will be in Adelaide. The Board
will be granted $ 15,000 to commission a major piece of
sculpture at the Regency Park Centre for Crippled Children,
Adelaide. The sculpture will become an important part
of the children's environment.
The Board will also be granted $ 10,000 towards the
cost of erecting a fountain designed by Mr. Robert Woodward
( the creator of the El Alamein Fountain in Kings Cross)
at the intersection of River and Northwood Road, Lane Cove,
and $ 5,000 for a sculpture to be placed in the
garden surrounding the Preston City Library, Melbourne.
CANBERRA. A. C. T.
